title: Planted Tank Ideas
description: Inspiring planted aquarium setups ranging from simple low-tech designs to competition-grade aquascapes. Browse real examples with full equipment and plant lists.

examples.title: Zen Forest Low-Tech 20 Long
examples.description: A serene low-tech aquascape built around a central manzanita driftwood piece draped in java moss. The foreground uses a carpet of dwarf sagittaria with anubias nana petite tucked into rock crevices. No CO2 injection required, making this an ideal first planted tank that still looks polished.

examples.title: Dutch Masterpiece 40 Breeder
examples.description: A classic Dutch-style layout with tightly grouped rows of stem plants arranged by height, color, and texture. Rotala rotundifolia, Ludwigia repens, and Pogostemon erectus create distinct color zones from deep red to bright green. This setup demands consistent dosing and weekly trimming to maintain the manicured look.

examples.title: Iwagumi Meadow 12 Gallon
examples.description: A minimalist Iwagumi layout using three dragon stones following the Sanzon arrangement. A dwarf baby tears carpet fills the foreground, with Monte Carlo softening the rock edges. The open swimming space and clean lines create a meditative aesthetic. Pressurized CO2 and strong lighting are essential for the carpet.

examples.title: Jungle Riparium 29 Gallon
examples.description: A wild, overgrown style where plants are encouraged to grow above the waterline. Pothos roots trail into the water, sword plants reach for the surface, and floating plants dim the light below. This style embraces chaos and rewards hands-off maintenance with a natural, untamed look.

title: Betta Tank Setups
description: Beautiful betta aquarium setups that prove these fish deserve far more than a bowl. Each example prioritizes betta health with gentle flow, warm water, and enrichment.

examples.title: Peaceful Betta Garden 10 Gallon
examples.description: A lush planted 10-gallon dedicated to a single male betta. Tall vallisneria in the back creates a curtain effect, while anubias and java fern on driftwood provide mid-level resting spots near the surface. A sponge filter keeps current gentle and the cobalt heater maintains a steady 78F.

examples.title: Blackwater Betta Biotope 5 Gallon
examples.description: A moody blackwater setup using Indian almond leaves and driftwood to tint the water amber. The tannin-rich environment mimics the natural habitat of wild bettas in Southeast Asian peat swamps. Minimal plants with floating salvinia complete the dark, atmospheric look. The low pH and soft water bring out vibrant betta colors.

examples.title: Betta Community 20 Long
examples.description: A carefully stocked community tank with a single male betta alongside peaceful tankmates. Ember tetras and corydoras share the space without triggering betta aggression. Dense planting with stem plants and floating cover gives the betta line-of-sight breaks and resting areas throughout the tank.

title: Community Tank Layouts
description: Proven community tank designs with compatible fish selections, balanced stocking, and thoughtful aquascaping for peaceful multi-species aquariums.

examples.title: Classic Community 29 Gallon
examples.description: The quintessential community tank with schools of neon tetras in the midwater, corydoras patrolling the bottom, and a pair of honey gourami as the centerpiece. Live plants provide cover and territories, while a mix of open swimming space and planted areas gives every species room to express natural behaviors.

examples.title: South American Biotope 55 Gallon
examples.description: A biotope-accurate South American setup with cardinal tetras, ram cichlids, and bristlenose plecos swimming among driftwood branches and fallen leaves. The substrate is fine sand, the water is slightly acidic, and the lighting is subdued to replicate a shaded forest stream. Authentic biotope tanks like this create a glimpse of a real ecosystem.

examples.title: Asian Hillstream Community 40 Breeder
examples.description: A high-flow setup designed around hillstream loaches and white cloud mountain minnows. River rocks and smooth pebbles create a fast-moving stream environment. A powerful canister filter pointed along the length of the tank generates the current these species crave. Cooler water temperatures of 68-74F set this apart from typical tropical setups.

examples.title: Peaceful Livebearer Paradise 20 Long
examples.description: A colorful livebearer community with guppies, platies, and endlers swimming in a densely planted tank. Java moss, water sprite, and hornwort provide hiding spots for fry, allowing some natural population growth. The bright colors and constant activity make this setup endlessly entertaining and perfect for families.

title: Nano Tank Inspiration
description: Creative nano aquarium setups under 10 gallons that prove big impact comes in small packages. Desktop-friendly designs with curated livestock and equipment.

examples.title: Shrimp Paradise 5 Gallon
examples.description: A dedicated cherry shrimp breeding tank with a carpet of java moss, a piece of cholla wood, and a sponge filter. The moss provides endless grazing surface for shrimp, and the small tank size makes it easy to maintain stable parameters. Watching shrimp graze, molt, and carry eggs is surprisingly addictive.

examples.title: Desktop Aquascape 3 Gallon
examples.description: A meticulously crafted 3-gallon aquascape with a single dragon stone, Monte Carlo carpet, and a small piece of driftwood. Pressurized CO2 from a paintball adapter system drives the carpet growth. Stocked only with a few cherry shrimp and a nerite snail for algae control. This tiny tank sits on a desk and draws constant attention.

examples.title: Betta Cube 5 Gallon
examples.description: A clean, modern 5-gallon cube dedicated to a single halfmoon betta. The hardscape uses a small manzanita branch with anubias nana attached, and the foreground is open sand for the betta to patrol. A low-profile heater and sponge filter keep the setup simple while meeting all of the betta's needs.

examples.title: Ember Tetra Nano Garden 8 Gallon
examples.description: A lushly planted 8-gallon tank housing a school of eight ember tetras and a handful of amano shrimp. The small scale of ember tetras makes an 8-gallon feel like a much larger display. Stem plants in the background frame a central driftwood focal point, and the warm orange of the tetras pops against the green foliage.
